import_type.question: What do you want to import?

device.question: What device is CrewLu installed on?

data_source_device.question: What device will you be getting the data from?

apple_id_check.question: Are you signed into the same Apple ID as your iPhone?

crewmember_type.question: What type of crewmember import do you want to do?

options.label: All Crewmembers on your aircraft type

source.question: Where is your schedule data coming from?

iphone-email.title: Import from Email on Your iPhone

steps.text: Open the email containing your schedule

media.caption: Locate and open the email with your crew schedule

steps.text: Long press on the schedule text to start selecting

media.caption: Long press to bring up the selection handles

steps.text: Drag the selection handles to select all schedule text

media.caption: Drag handles to select the entire schedule

steps.text: Tap 'Copy' to copy the selected text

media.caption: Tap Copy in the popup menu

steps.text: Open the CrewLu app and navigate to Import

media.caption: Find the Import option in CrewLu

steps.text: Paste your schedule data and tap Import

media.caption: Long press in the text field and select Paste

iphone-website.title: Import from Company Website on Your iPhone

steps.text: Open Safari and navigate to your company's crew scheduling website

media.caption: Open your crew scheduling website

steps.text: Log into your account if required

media.caption: Enter your credentials

steps.text: Find and view your schedule page

media.caption: Navigate to your schedule view

steps.text: Long press and select your schedule data

media.caption: Select the schedule information

steps.text: Copy the selected text

media.caption: Tap Copy from the menu

steps.text: Switch to CrewLu app and paste in the Import section

media.caption: Use app switcher to go to CrewLu

ipad-email.title: Import from Email on Your Personal iPad

steps.text: Open the Mail app on your iPad

media.caption: Launch the Mail app

steps.text: Find and open the email with your schedule

media.caption: Open the schedule email

steps.text: Use two fingers or double-tap to select the schedule text

media.caption: iPad text selection techniques

steps.text: Tap 'Copy' from the popup menu

media.caption: Select Copy from the context menu

steps.text: Open CrewLu app using the dock or home screen

media.caption: Launch CrewLu from dock or home screen

steps.text: Navigate to Import and paste your schedule

media.caption: Use the Import feature in CrewLu

mac-website.title: Import from Company Website on Your Mac

steps.text: Open your preferred web browser (Safari, Chrome, etc.)

media.caption: Launch your web browser

steps.text: Navigate to your company's crew scheduling website

media.caption: Go to your scheduling website

steps.text: Log in with your credentials

media.caption: Enter your login information

steps.text: Find your schedule and select the text (click and drag)

media.caption: Click and drag to select schedule text

steps.text: Copy the text (Cmd+C or right-click Copy)

media.caption: Copy using keyboard shortcut or context menu

steps.text: Since CrewLu is iOS-only, you'll need to transfer this data to your iPhone/iPad using AirDrop, email, or Messages

media.caption: Options to transfer data to iOS device

efk-tablet-pdf.title: Import from PDF on EFK Tablet

steps.text: Open the PDF containing your schedule

media.caption: Launch your PDF viewer app

steps.text: Long press and drag to select the schedule text

media.caption: Select text in PDF viewer

steps.text: Copy the selected text

media.caption: Use copy function

steps.text: Since EFK runs Android and CrewLu is iOS-only, you'll need to transfer this data to your iPhone/iPad

media.caption: Transfer options from Android to iOS

steps.text: Use email, cloud storage, or messaging apps to send the data to your iOS device

media.caption: Cloud transfer methods

steps.text: On your iOS device, open the transferred data and import to CrewLu

media.caption: Receive and import data on iOS

fullroster-iphone-iphone.title: Import Full Roster from iPhone to iPhone

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.

Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the phone. As long as the word Roster on the top is selected, all of the trips under and above will also be selected.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

fullroster-ipad-ipad.title: Import Full Roster from iPad to iPad

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.

Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the iPad. As long as the word Roster on the top is selected, all of the trips under and above will also be selected.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

fullroster-iphone-ipad.title: Import Full Roster from iPad to iPhone

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.

Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the phone. As long as the word Roster on the top is selected, all of the trips under and above will also be selected.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

fullroster-iphone-efk-no.title: Import Full Roster from EFK to iPhone (Different Apple IDs)
fullroster-iphone-efk-no.summary: This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your roster and expand all the arrows of all present and future trips, then we will airdrop the roster to your device.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/42850865184a465b8dd8e5b309b338c0

media.caption: Airdrop installation screen
Airdrop settings configuration

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Navigate to your Crew Access Roster. Expand every arrow in your current and future trips. It won't get imported if it can't be seen.

media.caption: Expand all arrows to show complete trip details

steps.text: Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add AirDrop to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Make sure your airdrop is set to everyone on both devices. Select the Share button and tap Airdrop To CrewLu. Accept the permissions if any come up. A second view will come up and you need to select the blue Airdrop button this time.

media.caption: Select Airdrop To CrewLu from the share menu
Tap the blue Airdrop button on the second prompt

steps.text: Select your iPhone from the AirDrop list. Your EFK will now prepare and send the roster page to your iPhone. Accept it and it will open a text document. On the bottom it will say Crewlu. Select that and it will open Crewlu and populate the text in the Import box. Just select import and you are done.

media.caption: Accept the AirDrop transfer on your iPhone
Tap the CrewLu button at the bottom to open the app

onetrip-iphone-mac.title: Import One Trip from Mac to iPhone

steps.text: Open the email containing your trip information

media.caption: Locate and open the email with your trip details

steps.text: Select the specific trip data you want to import

media.caption: Carefully select only the trip information you need

steps.text: Copy the selected trip data

media.caption: Tap Copy in the popup menu

steps.text: Open CrewLu and paste in the Import section

media.caption: Import your single trip data

crewmembers-all.title: Import All Crewmembers on Your Aircraft Type

steps.text: Access your crew list or roster data from your company system

media.caption: Open your crew roster or list

steps.text: Select and copy all crewmember information for your aircraft type

media.caption: Select all relevant crew data

steps.text: Open CrewLu and navigate to the Import section

media.caption: Find the Import option in CrewLu

steps.text: Paste the crew data and tap Import to add all crewmembers

media.caption: Import all crewmember data at once

steps.text: Find the specific crewmember's information you want to import

media.caption: Locate the specific crewmember data

steps.text: Select and copy only that crewmember's details

media.caption: Select individual crewmember information

steps.text: Open CrewLu and navigate to the Import section

media.caption: Find the Import option in CrewLu

steps.text: Paste the individual crew data and tap Import

media.caption: Import the single crewmember

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Navigate to your Crew Access Roster. Expand every arrow in your current and future trips. It won't get imported if it can't be seen.

media.caption: Expand all arrows to show complete trip details

steps.text: Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add AirDrop to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Make sure your airdrop is set to everyone on both devices. Select the Share button and tap Airdrop To CrewLu. Accept the permissions if any come up. A second view will come up and you need to select the blue Airdrop button this time.

media.caption: Select Airdrop To CrewLu from the share menu
Tap the blue Airdrop button on the second prompt

steps.text: Select your iPhone from the AirDrop list. Your EFK will now prepare and send the roster page to your iPhone. Accept it and it will open a text document. On the bottom it will say Crewlu. Select that and it will open Crewlu and populate the text in the Import box. Just select import and you are done.

media.caption: Accept the AirDrop transfer on your iPhone
Tap the CrewLu button at the bottom to open the app

deadhead-ipad-ipad.title: Import Jumpseat from iPad to iPad

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.
Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the iPad.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

deadhead-iphone-efk-yes.title: Import Jumpseat from EFK to iPhone (Same Apple ID)
deadhead-iphone-efk-yes.summary: This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your roster and expand all the arrows of all present and future trips, then we will airdrop the roster to your device.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/42850865184a465b8dd8e5b309b338c0

media.caption: Airdrop installation screen
Airdrop settings configuration

Tap the blue Airdrop button on the second prompt

fullroster-efk.title: Import Full Roster on EFK
fullroster-efk.summary: This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your roster and expand all the arrows of all present and future trips, then we will use the shortcut to import the roster.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/1c4eea69ff5e4130b05eb8d6ac28f99d

media.caption: Shortcut installation screen
Shortcut settings configuration

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Navigate to your Crew Access Roster. Expand every arrow in your current and future trips. It won't get imported if it can't be seen.

media.caption: Expand all arrows to show complete trip details

steps.text: Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Select the Share button and use the shortcut. Accept any permissions that come up.

media.caption: Select the shortcut from the share menu
Follow the prompts

steps.text: Your EFK will now prepare the roster page. The data will be copied to your clipboard and ready to paste into CrewLu. Open CrewLu and paste in the Import box, then select import and you are done.

media.caption: Data is prepared and copied
Open CrewLu and paste to import
